data.title: Come back stage
data.text: A wonderful surprise to walk to see a display that showed the history of the "blues and it's players".. You view exciting photos of artist, blues joints to country harmonica plays. The vibe is so exciting. The staff and owner were so personable. The experience of welcome and music and laugher are in this place. All flavors of art are in the building.

data.title: Photography & Music Special Event
data.text: They hosted a special event which interviewed the artist Bill Steber about his photography while he played live music which corresponded with his subject matter of Mississippi Blues culture. The event was a wonderful opportunity to hear first hand what motivates the artist and how he views the world and his subject matter. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.

data.title: Simply Perfect
data.text: There is no better Art Gallery in town! The work they carry is spectacular. The staff is kind, knowledgable and professional. This is the first Art Gallery I have ever walked in to where the staff does not make you feel like you don't belong there. Thank you Arts Company!!

data.title: Some place with substance.
data.text: I was quite impressed with the collection, and it was a refreshing activity to be able to take my daughter somewhere more enriching than a movie theatre for a change. The place is well put together, the owner was very friendly, and the ambience made it quite a relaxing visit.

data.title: Simply the Best!
data.text: Thanks to owner, Anne Brown, we have an arts community and Fifth Avenue of the Arts here in Nashville.  As Anne is the owner of this gallery, The Arts Company is perhaps the best gallery in town.  Whether you enjoy contemporary art from legendary artists like Brother Mel, Ed Clark, and Lonnie Holley, or you want to browse through the newest up-and-comers, The Arts Company is definitely worth taking the time to check out.  With a steady rotation in the downstairs gallery, you never know what you might see on any given day.  If you don't find what you are looking for, the incredibly kind staff may lead you upstairs where the abundance of collectable art is endless.  It is the perfect place if you are an avid collector, artist, businessman, college student, or just want to take a break from you day. A must see when you are in Nashville.  My personal favorites are the classic Ed Clark (LIFE photographer) photographs from a night at the Grand Ole Opry in 1946.
